question: Write the phrasal verb which means 'to take care of'.
description: -Look after – to take care of. (देखभाल करना)

question: Write the correct phrasal verb for the underlined word: The Chief guest distributed the prizes.
description: -Give away – to provide someone with something; to distribute something. (बांटना)

question: Write the meaning of the underlined phrasal verb: After ten years war, China gave in.
description: -Give in – to surrender. (आत्म-समर्पण करना)

question: Write the correct phrasal verb for the given word: Investigate
description: -Look into – to investigate. (छानबीन करना, जाँच-पड़ताल करना)

question: Write the correct meaning of the given phrasal verb: Call off
description: -Call off – to cancel or to end a project, an event or activity. (समाप्त करना, रद्द करना)

question: Write the meaning of the underlined phrasal verb: Do not run down your friends in public.
description: -Run down – to criticize. (किसी की आलोचना करना)

question: We decided to put off our visit to Kashmir till October: 'Put off' in the above sentence means–
description: -Put off – to postpone. (स्थगित करना, टाल देना)

question: Call in a doctor immediately! ‘Call in’ in the given sentence means–
description: -Call in – enlist someone's aid or services. (बुलाना)

question: Write the correct meaning of the underlined phrasal verb: John’s offer of help was turned down by the police.
description: -Turn down – to reject or refuse to consider an offer, a proposal, etc. (अस्वीकार कर देना)

question: Write the correct meaning of the underlined phrasal verb: Now it is difficult to carry on this business in the teeth of stiff competition.
description: -Carry on – to continue doing something, or to cause something to continue. (जारी रखना)

question: Write the correct meaning of the given phrasal verb: Get along
description: -Get along – have a friendly relationship. (मिलजुल कर रहना, मित्रवत् सम्बन्ध होना)

question: There isn't enough money, so we must cut down expenses. 'Cut down' in the given sentence means–
description: -Cut down – reduce an amount. (कम करना, कटौती करना)

question: Which phrasal verb can be associated with ‘Stop being angry or emotionally excited’?
description: -Calm down – stop being angry or emotionally excited. (शांत होना)

question: Fill in the blanks with the correct phrasal verb: She _________ the candle _________. (to extinguish)
description: -Put out – extinguish something that is burning. (आग बुझाना)

question: Write the meaning of the underlined phrasal verb: I am looking for my keys. Have you seen them?
description: -Look for – to search or to try to find. (खोजना, तलाश करना)

question: The new Prime Minister has been able to bear down all opposition: ‘Bear down’ in the sentence means–
description: -Bear down – to overthrow, to exert full strength and concentrated attention. (हराना)

question: Write the meaning of the underlined phrasal verb: I came across an old friend yesterday.
description: -Come across – to meet somebody by chance. (संयोग से मिलना)

question: Give the meaning of ‘Look forward to’–
description: -Look forward to – to feel pleased and excited about something that is going to happen. (ख़ुशी से प्रतीक्षा करना)

question: Write the meaning of the underlined phrasal verb: The girl took after her father. She is very amiable like him.
description: -Take after – be similar to a relative; resemble a parent or ancestor. (सदृश होना)

question: Write the meaning of the underlined phrasal verb: Raju had given up doing exercise after surgery.
description: -Give up – to stop trying to achieve something. (छोड़ना, त्यागना)

question: Write one word for: A remedy/cure for all diseases is _____________________.
description:
-Panacea – सर्वरोगहर औषधि
-Insolvent – दिवालिया
-Cure – इलाज
-Physiology – शरीर क्रिया विज्ञान

question: Write one word for: A person who looks on the bright side of things is __________________.
description:
-Optimist – आशावादी व्यक्ति
-Cynic – व्यक्ति जो सबको स्वार्थी समझता हो
-Favourable – अनुकूल
-Friendly – जिसमें आत्मीयता और खुलापन हो

question: Write one word for: A sweet dish served after the main meal is ___________________.
description:
-Dessert – भोजन के अंत में परोसा जाने वाला मधुर व्यंजन
-Desert – रेगिस्तान
-Boaster – डींग हांकने वाला
-Ambitious – महत्वाकांक्षी

question: Write one word for: A place where neither grass nor trees grow is ____________________.
description:
-Barren – बंजर
-Fertile – उपजाऊ
-Rough – खुरदुरा
-Hard – सख्त

question: Write one word for: A man who helps a stranger or a person in difficulties is ___________.
description:
-Samaritan – मुसीबत में मदद करने वाला
-Mercenary – खुदगर्ज़
-Stoic – साहसी
-Altruist – परोपकारी

question: Write one word for: A government by religious leaders is __________________.
description:
-Theocracy – धर्मतन्त्र
-Plutocracy – धनिक तन्त्र
-Democracy – जनतन्त्र
-Bureaucracy – अधिकारी तन्त्र

question: Write one word for: Killing of one's own child is __________________.
description:
-Filicide – पुत्र-हत्या
-Foeticide – भ्रूण हत्या
-Infanticide – शिशु हत्या
-Suicide – आत्महत्या

question: Write one word for: Animals eating food of all kinds is ______________________.
description:
-Omnivorous – सर्वाहारी, सर्वभक्षी
-Omnipresent – परमेश्वर
-Ostentatious – दिखावटी
-Obstetrician – प्रसुति विज्ञानी

question: Write one word for: The state of being unmarried is _____________________.
description:
-Celibacy – ब्रह्मचर्य
-Catalogue – सूची पत्र
-Brittle – नाजुक
-Cannibal – नरभक्षक

question: Write one word for: Extreme or irrational fear of entering open or crowded places is ________________________.
description:
-Agoraphobia – भीड़ का भय
-Xenophobia – विदेशी लोगों या अज्ञात लोगों का भय
-Pyrophobia – आग का भय
-Hydrophobia – जल का भय

question: Write one word for: One who holds a post without any salary is __________________.
description:
-Honorary – अवैतनिक
-Highbrow – घमंडी
-Volunteer – स्वयंसेवक
-Samaritan – धार्मिक

question: Write one word for: Someone who walks in sleep is _______________________.
description:
-Somnambulist – नींद में चलने वाला
-Recluse – एकान्तवासी
-Termagant – झगड़ालू
-Philogynist – दार्शनिक

question: Write one word for: A written declaration of Government or a political party is ____________.
description:
-Manifesto – घोषणापत्र
-Mosque – मस्जिद
-Menu – विकल्प सूची
-Patriot – देशभक्त

question: Write one word for: A person with strong desire to steal is ______________________.
description:
-Kleptomania – चौर्योन्याद, चोरी करने की बीमारी
-Nymphomania – निम्फोमानिया
-Logomania – जल्पनोन्माद
-Hypomania – हाइपोमानिया

question: Write one word for: A lover of good food is ________________.
description:
-Gourmand – खाने पीने का शौकीन
-Fugitive – भागने वाला
-Feminist – नारीवादी

question: Write one word for: Act of mercy killing is __________________.
description:
- Euthanasia – सुख-मृत्यु, इच्छा-मृत्यु
-Immolation – बलिदान
-Asphyxiation – श्वासावरोधन

question: Write one word for the underlined segment in the given sentence: I helped Sachin monetarily even though I knew that he is unable to pay his debts.
description:
-Insolvent/Bankrupt – दिवालिया
-Incapable – अक्षम
-Insolent – असभ्य
-Innate – जन्मजात

question: Write one word for: A fear of closed or dark place is _________________.
description:
-Claustrophobia – संवृतिभिति, बन्द जगहों से डर
-Xenophobia – विदेशी लोगों को नापसन्द करना
-Acrophobia – ऊँचाई से डर
-Pyro phobia – आग से डर

question: Write one word for: The act of killing one’s own father is _________________.
description:
-Patricide – पितृहत्या
-Parasite – कामचोर
-Fratricide – भ्रातृहत्या
-Regicide – राजहत्या

question: Write one word for: An official call to appear in a court of law is _____________________.
description:
-Summons – आह्वान पत्र, कचहरी का आदेश
-Infallible – अचूक
-Amputate – अंग-भंग करना
-Tempest – तूफानी होना

question: Principles of selection are based on the assumption that the whole system of the language–
option_1: cannot be taught within a short period.
option_2: can be taught within a short period.
option_3: can manage to learn the language.
description: -Principle of selection is based on the assumption that it is not possible to teach the whole system of the language within a short period. Because only limited things can be taught within a limited period so the teacher has to select a matter.

question: The principle of frequency implies–
option_1: those words are selected which are easy to teach.
option_2: those words are selected which are difficult to teach.
option_3: those words or structures should be taught which have a frequency of occurrence, i.e. which are used much.
description: -The principle of frequency implies those words or structures should be taught which have a frequency of occurrence, i.e. which are used much.

question: What are the principles on the basis of which the teaching matter should be selected?
description:
-Principles of selection and gradation focus on selecting language items involving:
-Learnability: how far an item is easy to learn.
-Teachability: how far an item is easy to teach.
-Availability: how far an item is convenient to teach.
-Range: in what different contexts a word can be used.
-Frequency: how often a particular word or item is used.
-Coverage: how many different meanings a word can convey.

question:
The teaching of English should we proceed spoken form to written form of LSRW.
Above sentence is about–
description:
-LSRW (Listening, Speaking, Reading, Writing)
-1. Listening: When people are learning a new language they first hear it spoken.
-2. Speaking: Eventually, they try to repeat what they hear.
-3. Reading: Later, they see the spoken language depicted symbolically in print.
-4. Writing: Finally, they reproduce these symbols on paper.

question: The principle of selection is based on the assumption that–
option_1: only a few selected and trained teachers can teach a language.
option_2: it is not possible to teach the whole language within the prescribed time period and the other constraints.
option_3: it is possible to select those who want to learn the target language.
option_4: only a few selected learners can learn the target language.
description: -The principle of selection is based on the assumption that it is not possible to teach the whole language within the prescribed time period and the other constraints.

question: The terms phonetic grouping, grammatical grouping, semantic grouping and structure grouping relate to–
description:
-Phonetic Grouping (ध्वन्यात्मक समूहीकरण) –minimal pairs are taught together.
eg. sea, tea, feed etc.
-Semantic Grouping (अर्थ संबंधी समूहीकरण) – the words that convey similar meaning are grouped under one head.
eg. The idea of shelter is given by house, tent, hut, hotel etc.
-Lexical Grouping (शाब्दिक समूहीकरण) – when words are grouped according to situation. It’s called lexical grouping.
eg. father, mother, sister, brother etc.
-Structural Grouping (संरचनात्मक समूहीकरण) – Place students in small groups to allow them to engage in different roles with peers to develop skills using the language in listening, speaking, reading and writing.

question: Principle of _______ emphasizes on model reading by the teacher.
description: -The principle of presentation emphasizes on model reading by the teacher. So that the students can learn the correct way of reading, pronunciation and intonation.

question: Gradation of language items should be based on–
description: -Gradation of language items should be based on simple to difficult.

question: Gradation of the language material means–
option_1: placing the language items in an order.
option_3: teaching the language items already taught.
description: -Gradation of the language material is placing words, vocabulary, sentence, other content etc. in an order.

question: Principle of habit formation included–
option_2: Habit for consulting a good dictionary
description:
-Principle of habit formation–
(i) Habit for going library
(ii) Habit for consulting a good dictionary
(iii) Habit for correct pronunciation
(iv) Habit for reading magazines, newspapers should be developed in reader/learners.

question: In communicative language teaching, the teacher presents a brief dialogue and–
option_1: allows oral practice of each utterance of the dialogue either in groups or individually.
option_2: does not participate in the lesson any more.
description: -In communicative language teaching, the teacher presents a brief dialogue and allows oral practice of each utterance of the dialogue either in groups or individually.

question: In communicative language learning–
option_1: teacher is a facilitator of learning.
option_2: the primary goal is fluency and acceptable language.
description: -In communicative language learning, grammatical explanation is avoided. The students must be allowed to make errors while communicating in the target language and the teacher must tolerate their errors so that students can express themselves effectively.

question: In communicative language teaching–
option_2: the learners get actively engaged in the process of learning.
description: -In communicative language teaching the learners get actively engaged in the process of learning. Learners converse about personal experiences with partners, and instructors teach topics outside of the realm of traditional grammar to promote language skills.

question: Communicative Language Teaching is ________ centred approach.
description:
-When the learners are involved in a real communication, their natural strategies for language acquisition will be used, and this will allow them to learn to use the language. A communicative approach is a student-centred approach that is dedicated to the language teaching of the target language that uses the language in the context of both linguistic and situations.
-In the CLT context, learner's role changes from that of a passive receiver to an active participant engaging in diverse classroom activities that promote communicative competence.

question: In CLT, the target language is learnt best when–
option_2: the learner reads in the target language.
description: -In CLT, the target language is learnt best when the learner attempts to communicate. According to CLT, the goal of language education is the ability to communicate in the target language. This is in contrast to previous views in which grammatical competence was commonly given top priority.

question: Grammatical or linguistic competence is–
option_1: the interpretation of individual message elements.
option_2: the communication of knowledge of grammar and vocabulary.
description: -The term linguistic competence or grammatical competence refers to the unconscious knowledge of grammar and vocabulary that allow a speaker to use and understand a language.

question: The Communicative English Language Teaching–
option_1: reverses the natural language learning process.
option_2: concentrates on the form of utterances.
option_3: resembles the natural language learning process in that the content of the utterances is emphasized.
description: -The Communicative English Language Teaching resembles the natural language learning process in that the content of the utterances is emphasized.

question: The term communicative function of language refers to–
option_1: how the speaker uses the language.
option_2: what the speaker uses language for.
description:
-The term communicative function of language refers to what the speaker uses language for. Communicative functions refer to the purpose
of gestural, vocal, and verbal acts intended to convey information to others.

question: Communicative competence includes–
option_1: knowledge of grammar, vocabulary and semantics of the language.
option_2: understanding the relationship between the language and its social context.
option_3: knowledge of how to start and end conversation.
description: -Communicative competence includes knowledge of grammar, vocabulary and semantics of the language, understanding the relationship between the language and its social context and knowledge of how to start and end conversation.

question: What is the chief role of a teacher in Communicative Language Teaching?
option_1: To facilitate the communication process between all participants in the classroom.
option_2: Role of an independent participant within the learning group.
option_3: Role of a researcher and learner.
option_4: All are the roles played by a teacher.
description: -In Communicative Language Teaching, a teacher facilitates the communication process between all participants in the classroom. He/She plays a role of an independent participant within the learning group, a researcher and learner.

question: What is the main purpose of Dr. West’s new method?
option_1: to develop the ability of reading.
option_2: to develop the ability of writing.
option_3: to develop the ability of speaking.
option_4: to develop the ability of learning.
description: -Dr. West’s new method puts emphasis on three important elements. First, reading, secondly, readers with selected vocabulary and thirdly, judicious use of the mother tongue.

question: Which method is known as old and classical method?
description: -Grammar cum Translation method is also known as Classical and Traditional method. It is a method of English language teaching. In this method, the learner first learns grammatical rules and then apply those rules in translating sentences from the target language into the mother tongue.

question: What do you understand by Bilingual Method?
option_1: It employs the students’ native language.
option_2: It’s predominantly the teacher who makes use of the first language.
option_3: It aims at enabling the students to become functional bilinguals.
description:
-The Bilingual Method–
allows limited and controlled use of mother tongue by the teacher.
is seen as a mid-way between the Grammar Translation Method and the Direct Method.
-C. J. Dodson developed the Bilingual Method.

question: What is the advantage of the Substitution Method?
option_2: It develops creative thinking in the students.
option_3: This method can’t be used to teach poetry and prose.
option_4: It lays emphasis on written work only.
description:
-Option (b) is the advantage of the Substitution Method.
-Advantages of the ‘Substitution Method’:
(i)It is based on a model sentence.
(ii)In this method a teacher can teach and the students can frame many sentences on the basis of the model sentence.
(iii)It is a very interesting method.
(iv)It develops creative thinking in the students.
(v)It is useful for teaching new words.
-Disadvantages of the ‘Substitution Method’:
(i)Complete grammar cannot be taught.
(ii)This method cannot be used to teach poetry and prose.
(iii)It lays emphasis on written work only.

question: What is the aim of the Structural approach?
option_1: To lay the foundation of English through drill and repetition of graded structures.
option_2: To enable pupils to attain mastery over the structures.
option_3: To lay proper emphasis on aural-oral skills.
description: -The purpose of the structural method is to improve the learning of grammar and writing by reading the text, not to make students memorize the rules of grammar.

question: Audio-Lingual Method–
option_1: develops and improves speech habits in students.
option_2: involves structures which are grasped by students directly.
option_3: permits very little use of mother tongue.
option_4: lays more emphasis on memorization of rules.
description: -The purpose of the Audio-Lingual Method is to give importance to the activities of reading and listening, rather than emphasizing the memorization of rules.

question: Which method of teaching originated in France 1901?
description: -The Direct Method originated in France in the year 1901. This method came as a reaction against the ‘Grammar-Translation Method’. It is also known as ‘Mother’s Method/ Natural Method/ Reformed Method/ Oral Method’. Direct method is a method of teaching English directly.

question: In which method grammar is taught as separate text book?
description: -In Grammar-cum-Translation Method, grammar is taught as separate text book. In this method grammar is taught systematically through extensive teaching of grammatical rules.

question: In the Structural approach–
option_2: reading and writing are taught before listening and speaking.
option_3: enough use of mother tongue is permitted.
description: -In the Structural approach, listening and speaking are developed. It is also known as ‘Aural-Oral Approach’. This is a modified form of ‘Direct Method’ because most of its characteristics are similar to those of the Direct Method.

question: What is the objective of Direct Method?
option_1: Creating direct bond between words and ideas.
option_3: Translation from English to mother tongue.
description: -The basic aim of the Direct Method is to teach any foreign language through conversation, discussion and reading in the target language by associating the experience and expression without using the students’ mother tongue. This Method gives much importance to speech.

question: A child-centred classroom is characterized–
option_1: very passive teachers and active leaners.
option_2: a variety of learning activities for the learners.
option_3: children sitting in the centre of the classroom.
option_4: children teaching other children under the supervision of the teacher.
description: -A child-centred education implies that the needs of the child are catered and in the classroom, there are different kinds of learners and for catering their needs there should different types of activities.

question: Difficulty of English teaching in India is due to–
description: -Besides all the above options, lack of competent teachers, over crowded classes, faulty method of teaching, low standard of text books, lack of proper teacher education, English teaching in India is difficult.

question: In a diverse classroom, learners find it difficult to speak and write good English and often lapse into their mother tongue because–
option_1: they are not motivated to learn.
option_2: they do not have the ability to learn English.
option_4: the lack of enough competence and the structures of the two languages are different.
description: -Learners lapse into their mother tongue, because the lack of enough competence in target language and grammatical structures of the two languages are different.

question: The disorder which is related to motor skills is–
description: -‘Dyspraxia’ is a developmental disorder of the brain in childhood causing difficulty in activities requiring co-ordination and movement. It is also known as developmental motor co-ordination disorder.

question: Dysgraphia is–
description: -‘Dysgraphia’ is a writing disorder associated with impaired handwriting.

question: A receptive language disorder affects–
option_1: the child’s ability to understand and comprehend language.
option_2: the child’s ability to pronounce words correctly.
option_3: the child’s ability to express his/her thoughts.
description:
-Receptive language disorder affects listening and reading.
-Receptive language disorder is one of three types of language disorder. It’s a lifelong condition that affects how people process spoken and written language. People with receptive language disorder struggle to understand words and connect them with ideas. So they don’t always get the meaning of what others are saying. That can make it hard to connect with people, whether it’s at school, at work, or in the community. And it can cause people to withdraw socially.

question: Problems of spelling errors of the students can be easily solved through–
description:
- Spelling errors can be easily solved through dictations.
-Dictation is the action of dictating words to be typed, written down, or recorded on tape.

question: A communication disorder that causes excessive wordiness and repetitiveness is–
description: -In psychology, logorrhoea is also known as press speech. It is a communication disorder that causes excessive wordiness and repetitiveness, which can cause incoherency.

question: To teach a visually impaired student the teacher should–
option_1: use the mother tongue as much as possible.
option_2: use cue cards to signal the teaching content.
option_3: be in touch with their parents.
description: -To teach a visually impaired student the teacher should use cue cards to signal the teaching content.

question: In an expressive language disorder–
option_1: the child has difficulty understanding language.
option_2: the child has difficulty using the language.
option_3: the child has difficulty in reading the text book.
description:
-In an expressive language disorder, the child has difficulty with using the language.
-Children with expressive language disorder have difficulty conveying or expressing information in speech, writing, sign language or gesture.

question: Knowledge of more than one language–
option_1: confuses the learner while trying to learn a new language.
option_2: becomes a burden to the teacher in language classroom.
option_3: interferes in learning a new language.
option_4: helps in the acquisition of a new language.
description:
-Knowledge of more than one language helps in the acquisition of a new language.
-Multilingualism is the knowledge of more than one language by a person or within a social group; it assumes the ability to switch from one language to another in speech, in writing, or in reading.

question: Multilingualism–
option_1: provides an insight into the understanding of different cultures.
option_2: makes it difficult to acquire a new language.
description: -Multilingualism provides an insight into the understanding of different cultures and experiences hence a multilingual becomes multicultural in nature. Since languages don't operate in a vacuum, culture and society play a key role in its existence.

question: What is/are the benefit/s of multilingualism?
option_1: Understanding and tolerance towards different cultures.
description:
-Benefits of multilingualism:
It boosts cognitive functions of child.
It enhances and improves memory.
It provides early exposure to the children.
It helps to understand and tolerance towards different cultures.
It enhances problem-solving abilities.
It your mind and worldview.
It opens you up to new cultures and to the fruits of diversity.
It will boost your confidence and increase self-esteem.
In a globalizing world, it gives you an advantage career-wise.

question: Multilingualism can be described as–
option_1: a person speaking more than one language.
option_2: a community of speakers where use of more than one language is common.
option_3: a student pursuing masters in more than one language.
description: -Multilingualism can be described as a person speaking more than one language and as a community of speakers where use of more than one language is common.

question: Mother tongue based multilingual advocates that–
option_1: learners begin their schooling in mother tongue and move on to add many languages in school.
option_2: learners begin with their state language and move on to English medium.
option_3: learners learn their mother tongue Hindi and English from class 1st.
option_4: all learners learn in mother tongue only in primary school.
description: -Mother tongue based multilingual advocates that learners begin their schooling in mother tongue and move on to add many languages in school.

question: What is necessary to make school environment friendly towards multilingualism?
option_1: Vocabulary development should be done in the native and second language.
option_2: Instruction and explanation of concepts to students should be given in more than two different languages.
description: -To make school environment friendly towards multilingualism, vocabulary development should be done in the native and second language.

question: Second language is __________ process and ___________ class-room training is required.
description: -Second language learning is a conscious process and to acquire proficiency in a second language, formal classroom training is required.

question: English is known as _____________ of the world.
description: -Lingua franca – a language that is adopted as a common language between speakers whose native languages are different.

question: The child learns his mother tongue more rapidly because–
option_1: he is given a conductive environment for speaking the language.
option_2: he is given a natural environment.
option_3: he is given a deductive environment.
description: -The child learns his mother tongue more rapidly because he is given a conductive environment for speaking the language. Mother tongue develops a child's personal, social and cultural identity.

question: Mother tongue is always learnt easily because of–
description: -Mother tongue is always learnt easily because of natural environment. Linguists say that the innate language learning ability of the human mind enables the child to learn the language by constructing the grammar of the language in his/her mind in a natural way.

question: The achievement test evaluates–
option_1: how much students have learned about the topic at the end of a specific period.
option_2: students’ overall skill in a language and is not related to a particular course or period.
description: -The achievement test is used to evaluate students’ learning process at the end of a specific period.

question: Multiple choice questions–
option_1: can test various levels of learning and evaluate learning at all levels of complexity.
option_3: test large knowledge base in a short time.
description:
-Options (a), (b) and (c) are correct for the MCQ, because they sample material more broadly and discrimination between performance levels is easier to determine.
-Objective Type Questions:
(i) Recognition type items–
MCQ, True/False, Matching
(ii) Recall type items–
Very Short Answer Type Questions

question: Testing includes–
description:
-Proficiency test – it determines the performance of individual laboratories for specific tests or measurements and is used to monitor laboratories' continuing performance.
-Achievement test – it is a test of developed skill or knowledge. The most common type of achievement test is a standardized test developed to measure skills and knowledge learned in a given grade level, usually through planned instruction, such as training or classroom instruction.
-Diagnostic test – it is a form of pre-assessment that allows a teacher to determine students' individual strengths, weaknesses, knowledge, and skills prior to instruction. It is primarily used to diagnose students' difficulties and to guide lesson and curriculum planning.

question: A language proficiency test is used to measure–
option_1: the ability of learners to use the language to communicate.
option_2: the knowledge of the content that is taught to them.
option_3: the efficiency of the teaching methods.
description:
-Achievement test – used to measure the learner’s knowledge of the content that has been taught.
-Language Proficiency Test (LPT) – used to measure the learner’s overall ability in the target language.

question: Continuous Assessment focuses on–
option_2: informal and a combination of both formative and summative.
description:
-‘Continuous Assessment’ focuses on informal and combination of both formative and summative assessment.
-‘Continuous Assessment’ is a form of educational examination that evaluates a student’s progress throughout a prescribed cause. It is advantageous as it provides immediate and repeated feedback to the students.

question: Objective of Remedial Teaching is–
option_3: to enhance learning interest and motivation.
description: -Besides the above three options (a), (b) and (c), to encourage pupils’ active participation in class activities, to focus on the learning process, to show concern for the performance of individual pupils and to help pupils with learning difficulties are the objectives of remedial teaching.

question: Why do we need Remedial teaching?
option_1: It fills in the gaps that have crept into the students’ learning.
option_2: It rectifies the concepts in English that have been misunderstood.
option_3: It accelerates the process of English language learning.
description: -Remedial teaching is a process that fills the gaps of students, learning rectifies their mistakes and helps them learn the language quickly. It is a process of removing the pupils' learning distortions or subject matter difficulties that have crept into the understanding and concept and use of that subject while learning.

question: The main purpose of remedial instruction is–
option_1: to select students for a particular course.
option_2: to enable the students to overcome the difficulties in learning.
option_3: to enable them to evaluate their own progress.
description: -The main purpose of remedial instruction is to enable the students to overcome the difficulties in learning. The objective of remedial teaching is to give additional help to learners who have fallen behind the rest of the class in any topic or subject. It is the process of identifying slow learners and providing them with the necessary help and guidance to overcome their problems.

question: A diagnostic test–
option_2: identifies the pupils who misbehave in class.
option_3: identifies strengths and weaknesses for remediation.
option_4: is not essential to remedial teaching.
description: -The main aim of a diagnostic test is to find out the cause of learning problems. The nature and purpose of diagnostic testing is to identify the areas of difficulties where the learner commits errors.

question: Why is remedial teaching organised?
option_1: To remove the difficulties of weak students.
option_4: To remove the difficulties of rich students.
description: -The objective of remedial teaching is to give additional help to learners who have fallen behind the rest of the class in any topic or subject. It is the process of identifying slow learners and providing them with the necessary help and guidance to overcome their problems.
